You can enjoy a day as an American sniper, a Soviet Soldier, or a ruffian from a Wild West film for an affordable price! Experience the largest Czech Republic gun range , only 40 minutes from Pragueâ€™s city center. Our gun range offers 4 open-air ranges with distances of 25-500 m . We provide ideal conditions for firearms such as assault rifles ( AK-47 , AR-15 ), sniper rifles ( Dragunov ), pump-action shotguns , pistols , and many more! We provide a variety of shooting activities that can accommodate beginners, gun safety and handling students, sport shooters and gun enthusiasts alike. In addition, our shooting range costs are some of the most affordable in the area, so an can enjoy a shooting experience without compromising safety and enjoyability. WE ARE NOT MIDDLEMEN , we are a team of professional instructors, former police officers and soldiers of the Czech army. Check out Our team or Facebook and Instagram to see some recent events. Book it now by selecting your shooting package. SELECT YOUR PACKAGE HOW THE SHOOTING ACTIVITY WORKS? HOW THE SHOOTING ACTIVITY WORKS? We can handle individuals and groups up to 60 people. Shooting activities in Prague is available all year round to anyone over the age of 12. More info in FAQ PAGE. 1) BOOK Your shooting ACTIVITY Package Choose the most suitable shooting package and send us the reservation form. We will contact you within 24 hours with the reservation details. 2) TRANSPORTATION TO THE EVENT FROM THE HOTEL We will pick you up from the hotel and transport you to the gun range on the day of the event. We will then take you back after the activity. The way takes about 40 minutes in one direction. 3) ENJOY THE SHARPSHOOTING EXPERIENCE You can try up to 25 legendary rifles and pistols. Upon your request, we can provide almost any weapon. Ammunition is included in price. 4) SHOOTING COMPETITION AND GLORY TO THE WINNERS Enjoy a small lunch and drinks after your shooting activities. If your group chooses to have a competition, we will announce the winners before departure. SELECT YOUR PACKAGE FAQ FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS We have answers to your questions. Most of the times... In other cases, please contact us . ORDERS How do I place an order? The best way to place an order is to use the ORDER FORM on our website. On the page of the specific package click on BOOK NOW. Then fill in your details and your preferred event date and time and CLICK SUBMIT. We will confirm your order within 30 minutes by email or phone. You can also order directly by phone at +420 228 883 526 or by email at info@pragueranger.cz. When do you confirm the booking We confirm your booking within 30 minutes by email and/or phone, usually in 15-20 minutes. What is 100% moneyback guarantie? We provide only 100% service. If you are not satisfied with our shooting course. Let us know what where we failed and we refund you the money partialy or fully. You can contact us via email with you request. Do you offer hotel pickup and drop off? Yes. We provide hotel pick-up and drop-off for our outdoor shooting courses. If you stay in the city centre, where is complicated to get by bus, we offer a meeting point nearby. Do you accept last minute bookings? Yes, we will do our maximum to find availabile places also for last minute or same day booking. We highly recommend to book the session in advance at least 2 days before the evnet. I didnt get the confirmation email Please check first your email SPAM folder. If you have any trouble with the booking, please contact us by phone. Do you accept individuals and small groups? Yes, we accept single shooters and groups too. Can each participant have a different package? Yes, no problem. You can mix packages in your group, no problem. Leave us the note what packages you want or order multiple packages via booking form. Do you offer any group discounts? Yes, we offer several group discounts, starting from 10 people in the group. We also offer regular promotions, check our social media. More Less PAYMENT Do you accept credit cards? Yes, if you pay in advance, you can pay online by credit card, PayPal or Bank transfer. On site, we accept only cash, we accept CZK or EUR. Is it possible to purchase more shots? Yes, you can buy more ammunition or add weapons to the package directly at the range. Do you require a pre-payment? Yes. We require a deposit for all outdoor shooting events because we have to reserve multiple components - range, equipment, bus, driver, refreshments, drinks, etc. Indoor shooting is generally without the deposit, except for larger groups and busy weekends. How much is the deposit The deposit is 20 EUR per person, but we usually charge smaller flat fee of 150 EUR for every 5-10 shooters depending on the total amount. When do I pay the balance? You will pay the balance at the shooting range. Please bring right amount, we accept only cash, CZK or EUR. Can I get an invoice with my VAT? Of course, but please let us know in advance, that you need an invoice issued to your company with VAT. There are several tax rules applied to the service like reverse charge etc. After the event, we are not able to reissue the invoice. Until when can I cancel my reservation? You can cancel your reservation at any time up to 24 hours before the event with a full refund of your deposit. When do I get my refund? We will refund you via PayPal or bank transfer. Depending on your bank, you should have the money back in your account within 3-4 business days. What if I donâ€™t arrive or arrive late? We understand that plans can change. However, if you donâ€™t cancel at least 24 hours before the event and either donâ€™t show up or arrive late to the appointment, weâ€™ll need to charge a cancellation fee of 50% of the original price of the ordered product. This fee covers costs such as transportation, instructor wages, shooting range fees, and more. Thank you for your understanding! For more details, please read our Terms and Conditions page. More Less On the range What should I bring to the range? At the shooting range you will primarily need proof of identity - ID, passport, driving licence or firearms licence. Also, remember sturdy shoes and weather-appropriate clothing for the outdoor range. Can I come with a friend or family? Of course, your friend can come with you as support. At the outdoor range he has to pay 20 EUR for the price of transport and admission to the shooting range. Do I need a firearms licence to shoot? You dont need one, all our shooting packages include instructor time to spend with you. Under the supervision of an instructor, a license is not required. Can I drink alcohol before and during shooting? No, we dont serve alcohol in the range during the shooting. You should come to the range sober. If you are planning a visit to the range as part of your celebration. Schedule the shooting at the beginning of your event. How do I get to the range? The outdoor shooting range is 45 minutes from the city centre and transport to the site is included in the price. Can my childs shoot as well? According to Act No.119/2002 Coll., on firearms and ammunition, a person over the age of 10 may be entrusted with a firearm if accompanied by a legal guardian. We recommend at least 12 years of age. Can two persons share one package? No. We dont allow to divide any shooting package into multiple persons. Especialy bigger packages, are set with skills progress
summary: RANGER PRAGUE Shooting Range offers a unique shooting experience in Prague, featuring a variety of firearms and professional instruction from former military personnel. The facility caters to both beginners and experienced shooters, providing a safe and enjoyable environment to learn and practice shooting skills.
focus_topics: Soviet Army, AK-47, Dragunov, Military Training
personalization_hooks: The range offers a chance to experience shooting with legendary firearms like the AK-47 and Dragunov, appealing to enthusiasts of Soviet military history. | The instructors are former police officers and soldiers of the Czech army, providing authentic military training insights. | The facility emphasizes safety and professional instruction, making it an ideal environment for learning about firearms used in historical conflicts.
relevance_reasoning: While the organization focuses on shooting experiences rather than historical education, it does provide opportunities to engage with iconic Soviet firearms, which could attract interest from those studying Soviet military history.

summary: PÄ›hotnÃ­ srub BÅ™ezinka is a military history organization focused on preserving and showcasing the history of Czechoslovak fortifications from 1935-38, particularly through the BÄ›loveskÃ½ fortification museum. They offer guided tours and exhibitions that allow visitors to experience military history firsthand.
focus_topics: Czechoslovak Army, Fortifications, Military Equipment
personalization_hooks: The BÅ™ezinka fortification is fully reconstructed to its 1938 state, providing a unique glimpse into pre-WW2 military architecture. | The museum features a documentary film about the Czechoslovak Army during the First Republic, which is a rare focus in military history. | They recently added a replica of a heavy machine gun mount, appealing to enthusiasts of military technology and fortification.
relevance_reasoning: While the organization focuses primarily on Czechoslovak military history, it does not directly address Soviet or Russian military history. The relevance is limited, as the content is more about local fortifications and the Czechoslovak Army rather than Soviet military artifacts or history.

David F, ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§United Kingdom, Jul 2020 Description Get behind the trigger of the world's most famous rifles, pistols, revolvers, shotguns & machine guns, and blast away some targets! With ShootingRangePrague.com, you can enjoy a unique gun firing adventure without a shooting license or any previous experience. You will shoot under the supervision of certified range instructors who are current or former military or law enforcement officers with many years of experience. They will explain safety instructions, proper gun handling, and helpful shooting techniques and assist you during the whole shooting session. Their goal is to introduce you to the fascinating world of firearms and to have fun while being 100% safe. Pick-up Our driver picks you up at your chosen address in Prague. It may be your accommodation, a restaurant etc., any place you prefer. Ride to the range 30 minutes Enjoy a comfy ride in an AC van or car. From Prague centre to our indoor range it lasts 30 min, to the outdoor range 45 min. Briefing 15 minutes Your professional, English-speaking instructor explains the proper and safe way to handle and use each gun and assists you with every step of the shooting event. Time to hit the target! 20 minutesâ€“1 hour Get behind the trigger of some of the world's most famous weapons and blast away some targets! Enjoy to a maximum their awesome firepower instructed and supervised by an experienced professional. Extras If you don't have enough adrenaline yet, you can buy more ammo or rent other guns. Photoshoot During the shooting, you can take photos & videos of each other and afterwards pose with the unloaded guns for pictures. The instructor can take them for you if you are a single traveller or if you wish to have a group photo. Ride back 30 minutes The driver takes you back to your preferred address in Prague, which may differ from the pick-up point. You are welcome to take the target as a memory of your shooting adventure :) Drop-off Enjoy the rest of your day in the magical city of Prague, and we already look forward to meeting you again soon! Notes The minimal required age of participants is 10. An adult must accompany children under the age of 18. Shooting is not recommended for pregnant women. It's not allowed to shoot under the influence ofâ€‹ alcohol or drugs. Persons under the influence of alcohol will be denied the use of guns, for their own and other peopleâ€™s safety. If there are any doubts, the person may be asked to use an alcohol tester at the range to prove compliance with this rule and 50 % storno fee will be charged. Should a gun be temporarily unavailable for technical reasons, we reserve the right to replace it with a similar model of equal value to ensure experience remains unaffected 632 customer reviews I have been shooting in the United States, Korea and other locations in Europe, but this was by far the best experience. summary: The Museum of Armored Weapons in PoznaÅ„ is dedicated to preserving and showcasing the history of armored military vehicles and equipment, particularly focusing on Polish and Soviet military history. summary: Stowarzyszenie Rekonstrukcji Historycznej REGA is a historical reenactment association focused on educating the public about military history through immersive experiences and events. Founded in 2016, the organization aims to share knowledge and skills related to historical reconstruction without any ideological or totalitarian affiliations.
focus_topics: German Army, Italian Campaign, Military Equipment
personalization_hooks: The organization has a strong local connection to the Rega River, which inspired its name. | They have participated in various historical events, including the 'ÅabiszyÅ„skie Spotkania z HistoriÄ…' focused on the Italian Campaign. | They emphasize that their activities are purely educational and do not promote any totalitarian ideologies.
relevance_reasoning: While the organization focuses primarily on World War II and does not explicitly cover Soviet/Russian military history, their educational approach and participation in historical events may provide opportunities for discussions on military equipment and tactics used during the war, including those related to the Soviet Army.

summary: The Library of the Military History Institute in Prague serves as a specialized public library that provides a range of library and information services focused on military history. It supports research and education through its extensive collection of books, journals, and digital resources related to military history, particularly in the context of Czech and broader European military developments.
focus_wars: World War I, World War II, Cold War
focus_topics: Soviet Army, Czechoslovak military history, Military Equipment
personalization_hooks: The library offers access to a unique digital collection of military history resources, including rare documents and publications. | It provides specialized reference and research services, making it a valuable resource for scholars and enthusiasts of military history. | The library's focus on the history of the Soviet Army and its impact on Central Europe can provide insights into the broader context of military conflicts.
relevance_reasoning: The library's extensive resources on military history, particularly related to the Soviet era and its military, make it highly relevant for selling authentic Soviet military boots. The focus on research and education in this area indicates a potential interest in authentic military artifacts.

Founded in 2013, the museum also engages in historical reenactments and educational events, making military history accessible to the public.
focus_topics: Soviet Army, Military Equipment, Reconstruction of Historical Events
personalization_hooks: The museum features the largest collection of bombs, mines, and artillery ammunition in Poland, making it a unique destination for military enthusiasts. | Most exhibits are operational, allowing visitors to see military vehicles in action, which enhances the educational experience. | The museum has collaborated with historical film productions, showcasing its artifacts in popular films and series, linking military history to contemporary culture.
relevance_reasoning: The museum's focus on military technology and its operational exhibits provide a direct connection to Soviet military history, particularly through its collection and educational activities. summary: The Aircraft Museum Prague-Kbely is dedicated to preserving and showcasing the history of Czechoslovak and Czech aviation, particularly military aviation. Established in 1968, it houses a significant collection of aircraft and related artifacts, making it one of the largest aviation museums in Europe.
focus_topics: Czechoslovak Aviation, Military Aircraft, Aviation History
personalization_hooks: The museum features nearly 275 aircraft, including unique global specimens. | It is located on the site of the first airbase established after the founding of Czechoslovakia in 1918. | The museum offers free admission and has a dedicated space for educational tours.
relevance_reasoning: While the museum focuses primarily on Czechoslovak and Czech aviation history, it does not specifically emphasize Soviet or Russian military history. However, there may be overlaps in aircraft types and historical context due to the Cold War era.

summary: The Museum of Arms and Weapons in Åšwidnica, Poland, showcases a diverse collection of over 2000 military artifacts, including unique items from various conflicts and eras. Established in 1999, it serves as an educational institution under the patronage of the Ministry of National Defense, focusing on preserving military history and promoting national identity.
focus_topics: Soviet Army, Military Equipment, Cold War Artifacts

relevance_reasoning: The museum's extensive collection of Soviet military artifacts and its focus on the Cold War era make it highly relevant for selling authentic Soviet military boots, as it attracts visitors interested in Soviet military history and memorabilia.

summary: The Museum of Cursed Soldiers and Political Prisoners of the Polish Peopleâ€™s Republic is dedicated to preserving the memory of anti-communist soldiers and political prisoners in Poland during the post-war era. It serves as a historical site that educates visitors about the struggles faced by these individuals under communist rule.
focus_topics: Political repression, Anti-communist resistance, Post-war Poland
personalization_hooks: The museum is located at Rakowiecka 37, a site historically significant for the imprisonment and execution of anti-communist fighters. | The museum offers free admission and requires prior booking for group visits, making it accessible for educational trips. | It features unique collections and exhibitions that highlight the stories of individuals like Witold Pilecki, who fought against the communist regime.
relevance_reasoning: The museum focuses on the impact of Soviet influence in Poland during the Cold War, making it relevant for those interested in the broader context of Soviet military history and its repercussions on individual lives and national identity.

It aims to educate the public through exhibitions, collections, and events that highlight the significance of this global conflict.
focus_topics: Soviet Army, Red Army, Military Equipment, Civilian Impact of War
personalization_hooks: The museum features a unique collection of artifacts from the Eastern Front, showcasing the Soviet perspective of World War II. | It offers interactive exhibits that allow visitors to experience the challenges faced by soldiers and civilians during the war. | The museum hosts annual events that commemorate significant battles and moments in WWII history, attracting historians and enthusiasts alike.
relevance_reasoning: The museum's focus on the Soviet Army and its role in WWII makes it highly relevant for selling authentic Soviet military boots, as it aligns with the interests of visitors who are likely to appreciate and seek out authentic military memorabilia.

name: Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum
scraped_content: PISM | Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum | Instytut Polski i Muzeum gen. Sikorskiego info@pism.org.uk Support Us Contact Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions Collect â€“ Preserve â€“ Promote The Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum Unique Collection of Polish Memorabilia and Documents Museum Archive The Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum PISM is the largest archival and museum institution in Western Europe that is focused on Polish history, predominantly covering the first half of the 20th century. From its foundation in 1945 until the fall of communism in 1989, the Institute was one of the main exiled institutions where Polandâ€™s true history was presented to the public. Archive Filling approximately 2 km of shelf space, the Archive contains important documents from a range of historical periods. Museum The Museum collections include artefacts from various genres and times in Polish history. Film & Sound Archive Over 1300 reels of film and sound recordings. Photograph, Book & Album Collections Thousands of negatives, photographs, books, chronicles and albums. Our aim is to â€˜collect, conserve and promoteâ€™. You are welcome to carry out research and to view our exhibits. The extent of our collections often comes as a surprise and we would like to introduce you to the rich tapestry of Polish History. For some of our visitors, it is a journey into a time that was talked about by their parents and grandparents. For others, it is a meeting with tangible relics of the past, about which they may have heard or read. We hope that you may be moved by the experience and inspired to find out more. We have a team of trained guides who will enrich your visit to our museum and a team of professional archivists and historians to assist you in using our archives. Whether you are a historian, student or just interested in Polish history, we are sure that you will find something in our collections that will match your interests. To find out more and to see examples of our Institute Collections, please explore below . We look forward to seeing you. Institute Collections All rights to the images on this website are vested in the Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum. Reproduction by prior approval only. Archive Click hereâ€¦ Museum Click hereâ€¦ Film & Sound Archive Click hereâ€¦ Photographs, Books & Albums Click hereâ€¦ Support Us The Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum is a registered charity (no. 312168) and other than funds that we generate through our activities, we are totally reliant on membership, donations and legacies to enable us to carry on with our work. Make a Donation Website under reconstruction. Some materials may be unavailable. We invite you to visit us. The PISM Archive Reading Room will be closed from 23 December 2025 to 2 January 2026 inclusive. Thank you for years of service Andrzej Tadeusz PaweÅ‚ Suchcitz is a Polish historian, archivist and publicist. He is a specialist in modern Polish history and military affairs. After 36 years as Keeper of Archives of the Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum and the Polish Underground Movement Study Trust he is retiring on 31 st October 2025. As of 1 st November 2025, Ms. Jadwiga Kowalska M.A. has been appointed Keeper of Archives of the Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum. Ã— We use cookies to ensure that we give you the best experience on our website. If you continue to use this site we will assume that you are happy with it. Ok
summary: The Polish Institute and Sikorski Museum (PISM) is dedicated to preserving and promoting Polish history, particularly from the first half of the 20th century. It houses a vast collection of archival materials, artifacts, and recordings that reflect Poland's military and cultural heritage, especially during and after World War II.
focus_topics: Polish military history, Soviet Army, Polish Underground Movement
personalization_hooks: PISM is the largest archival and museum institution in Western Europe focused on Polish history, which includes significant documentation of the Soviet influence during the Cold War. | The museum features a unique collection of over 1300 reels of film and sound recordings that capture the Polish experience during WWII and the Soviet era. | The transition of leadership from a long-serving archivist to a new keeper of archives may indicate a fresh perspective on the collection and its relevance to current historical discourse.
relevance_reasoning: The organization focuses on Polish military history during the Soviet era, making it relevant for discussions on Soviet military artifacts. Their extensive archives and collections provide valuable insights into the impact of Soviet military actions on Poland, enhancing the context for authentic Soviet military boots.

summary: Military Museum LeÅ¡any is a prominent military technical museum located in the Czech Republic, showcasing over 700 historical military vehicles and equipment from various periods, particularly focusing on Czechoslovak military technology. The museum is known for its unique collections, including Czechoslovak military transport vehicles from 1918-1939 and Cold War-era military technology.
focus_topics: Czechoslovak Military History, Cold War Military Equipment, Soviet Army Technology
personalization_hooks: The museum features a unique collection of Czechoslovak military vehicles from 1918-1939, which could appeal to those interested in early 20th-century military history. | Annual events like the Tank Days showcase historical military technology in action, providing a dynamic experience for visitors. | The museum's focus on Cold War-era technology, including both Warsaw Pact and NATO equipment, offers a comparative perspective on military history.
relevance_reasoning: The museum's extensive collection of Cold War military technology, including Soviet and NATO equipment, makes it highly relevant for those interested in authentic Soviet military history. Its focus on Czechoslovak military contributions during this period provides a unique angle for outreach.

summary: The National Memorial to the Heroes of the Heydrich Terror serves as a historical site commemorating the resistance against Nazi occupation during World War II, specifically focusing on the events surrounding the assassination of Reinhard Heydrich. It features exhibitions related to Operation Anthropoid and honors the bravery of Czechoslovak paratroopers who fought against the regime.
focus_topics: Czechoslovak resistance, Nazi occupation, Operation Anthropoid
personalization_hooks: The memorial includes a crypt where seven paratroopers hid for 21 days after the assassination of Heydrich, culminating in a fierce battle. | The exhibition was inaugurated on the 80th anniversary of the events, highlighting the historical significance of the resistance. | Unique artifacts and audiovisual presentations enrich the visitor experience, making it a compelling site for those interested in military history.
relevance_reasoning: While the memorial focuses on the Czechoslovak resistance during WWII, it does not directly relate to Soviet or Russian military history. The content is more centered on the local resistance against Nazi forces rather than Soviet military actions or equipment.

summary: The Belarusian State Museum of the History of the Great Patriotic War is dedicated to preserving, studying, and promoting the historical memory of the Great Patriotic War, particularly focusing on the contributions and sacrifices of the Belarusian people. The museum hosts various exhibitions, educational programs, and commemorative events to honor the legacy of the war and its impact on Belarusian society.
focus_topics: Soviet Army, Belarusian Resistance, Military Equipment
personalization_hooks: The museum is celebrating its 80th anniversary in 2024 and is inviting the public to share archival photographs and articles related to its history. | The museum features a variety of virtual exhibitions that explore different aspects of the Great Patriotic War, including the experiences of soldiers and civilians. | The museum conducts unique educational quests and excursions that engage visitors in the history of the war and its heroes.
relevance_reasoning: The museum's focus on the Great Patriotic War and its historical significance in Soviet military history makes it highly relevant for selling authentic Soviet military boots, as these items would resonate with visitors interested in the era and its military heritage.

name: WWII in Prague Tour
scraped_content: WW2 in Prague Tour & Operation Anthropoid Museum PÅ™ejÃ­t k obsahu +420 605 918 596 info@anthropoidtour.com Tripadvisor reviews Google reviews WW2 IN PRAGUE TOUR WITH OPERATION ATHROPOID MUSEUM On this historical WW2 in Prague Tour, visitors explore Operation Anthropoid's crypt and museum, journeying through a 12th century underground cellars that served as a makeshift shelter from the carpet bombing at the end of the war and many other significant sites associated with World War Two and the Nazi occupation. Prague WW2 and Anthropoid Tour - Adolf Hitler, Reinhard Heydrich, Heinrich Himmler and Karl Wolff - Prague Castle , Invasion day 16th ofMarch 1939 Embark on an immersive journey through Pragueâ€™s history on our WW2 in Prague Tour. With licensed local guides, explore Old Townâ€™s Nazi occupation remnants and significant wartime events. Visit a 12th-century palaceâ€™s underground cellars, housing our private WWII artifact collection, including personal documents and items that belonged to Resistance fighters, Czechoslovak pilots and also Gestapo members. Explore the crypt and museum beneath the Saints Cyril and Methodius Cathedral, learn about Operation Anthropoid targeting SS ObergruppenfÃ¼hrer Reinhard Heydrich , and hear about the brave Czechoslovakian paratroopers involved. A barricade built by Prague rebels in Celetna Street at the end of WWII - 8th of May 1945 Discover the inspiring tales of the courageous citizens of Prague who confronted the Nazi regime and emerged as unsung heroes. Uncover their narratives of bravery, selflessness, and defiance, and acquire a deeper comprehension of the profound effects of World War Two on Prague. As you join our knowledgeable guides, be prepared for an enlightening encounter that transcends mere historical facts. Our guides are passionate storytellers, weaving together the threads of history to offer you a comprehensive and transformative understanding of Prague. Your perception of this city is not just a journey through time; itâ€™s a profound exploration that will leave an indelible mark, connecting you intimately with the enduring legacy of those who faced adversity with courage and determination. WWII in Prague Tour The 12th century underground of the palace U Kunstatu - 1945 Bomb Shelter WW2 in Prague Tour Our tour guide at work Anthropoid tour Prague - A gun and personal belongings of the Czechoslovak paratroopers. Prague WW2 nd Anthropoid Tour The Crypt of the operation Anthropoid See the scars of war and silent remains of Operation Anthropoid Our expert guide will take you to the sites and landmarks that played a vital role in WW2 A story of our resistance told in front of the house in which they were hiding in 1942 Sten sub-machine gun was the weapon of choice for SOE agents - Memorial Operation Anthropoid Our knowledgeable guide will bring the stories and legends of this period to life BOOK NOW Â© 2023 anthropoidtour.com - Created by pagestudio.cz
summary: WWII in Prague Tour offers immersive historical tours focusing on World War II events in Prague, particularly highlighting Operation Anthropoid and the city's resistance against Nazi occupation. Visitors explore significant sites, including underground cellars and museums, while learning about the bravery of Czechoslovakian paratroopers and local citizens during the war.
focus_topics: Operation Anthropoid, Nazi occupation, Czechoslovak resistance
personalization_hooks: The tour includes access to a private collection of WWII artifacts, including items belonging to Resistance fighters and Gestapo members. | Visitors can explore a 12th-century underground shelter that served as a refuge during the bombings at the end of the war. | The tour features stories of unsung heroes from Prague who bravely confronted the Nazi regime.
relevance_reasoning: While the organization focuses primarily on World War II and the specific events in Prague, there is limited direct relevance to Soviet/Russian military history, as the emphasis is on Czechoslovak resistance rather than Soviet military actions or equipment.

summary: StarÃ¡ Aerovka is part of the VHU PRAHA Aviation Museum in Kbely, which focuses on the history of Czechoslovak and Czech aviation, particularly military aviation. relevance_reasoning: While the museum focuses primarily on Czechoslovak military history, it does not directly engage with Soviet or Russian military history. The relevance is limited due to the specific focus on Czechoslovak fortifications and the interwar period rather than broader Soviet military themes.

summary: The Ordynariat Polowy Wojska Polskiego serves as the military ordinariate of the Polish Armed Forces, providing spiritual guidance, pastoral care, and support for military personnel and their families. It organizes religious events, commemorations, and cultural activities that honor the contributions of soldiers and the history of the Polish military.
focus_topics: Military Chaplaincy, Military Commemorations, Religious Services for Soldiers
personalization_hooks: The organization actively participates in commemorating significant military events, such as the centenary of the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. | It organizes pilgrimages and religious services that connect military history with faith, such as the introduction of the JasnogÃ³rska icon in Notre-Dame. | The presence of military chaplains at key events highlights the integration of faith and service in the Polish military tradition.
relevance_reasoning: While the organization is focused on the spiritual and pastoral aspects of military life in Poland, it does not directly engage with Soviet or Russian military history. Its activities are more centered around Polish military heritage and faith rather than the historical analysis or collection of Soviet military artifacts.

focus_topics: Soviet Army, Red Army, Military Equipment
personalization_hooks: The museum houses the only extensive collection of military vehicles in northeastern Poland, making it a unique destination for military history enthusiasts. | Visitors can experience rides in heavy military equipment, including the T-55 tank, providing a hands-on understanding of military machinery. | The museum organizes educational activities for youth, promoting awareness and appreciation of military history.
relevance_reasoning: The museum's focus on vehicles used by the former Warsaw Pact, particularly the Soviet Army, aligns closely with the interest in authentic Soviet military history and equipment, making it a relevant source for enthusiasts and collectors.

summary: VojenskÃ© muzeum is a military museum located in a small village near the ruins of Trosky Castle, dedicated to preserving and showcasing artifacts from various conflicts, particularly focusing on the periods of 1866 to 1945. The museum offers insights into the military history of the region and engages visitors with exhibitions related to significant wars.
focus_topics: Czechoslovak military history, World War I, World War II, military equipment
personalization_hooks: The museum is located near the historic Trosky Castle, which adds a unique scenic aspect to the military history experience. | It covers a wide range of conflicts, including lesser-known wars, providing a comprehensive view of military history. | The museum features a collection of military artifacts that may include items from the Soviet era, appealing to those interested in Soviet military history.
relevance_reasoning: While the museum does touch upon significant conflicts including World War II, its primary focus appears to be on a broader historical context rather than exclusively on Soviet or Russian military history. This makes it moderately relevant for selling authentic Soviet military boots, as the connection may not be direct but could attract interest from visitors looking for related memorabilia.

summary: The Museum of Military History Piestany serves as a dedicated institution for preserving and showcasing the military history of Czechoslovakia from the end of World War II until 1992. It features extensive exhibitions of military equipment and artifacts, emphasizing the armaments used by the Czechoslovak Army.
focus_topics: Czechoslovak Army, Military Equipment, Air Defense
personalization_hooks: The museum covers over 41,000 mÂ² with more than 400 3D objects, providing a comprehensive view of Czechoslovak military history. | The first stable exhibition opened in 2004, focusing on Czechoslovak Army armaments from 1945 to 1992, highlighting a unique period in military history. | The museum is located on the site of a former air base, adding historical significance to its exhibitions.
relevance_reasoning: While the museum primarily focuses on Czechoslovak military history, it provides insights into the military context of the Soviet era, which is relevant for understanding the broader implications of Soviet military influence in Central Europe. However, it may not directly cater to those specifically seeking authentic Soviet military boots.

summary: The Lubuskie Military Museum is dedicated to preserving and promoting Polish military history, particularly focusing on the journey to independence. It engages the public through various educational programs, exhibitions, and community events that celebrate national heritage and encourage active participation in historical remembrance.
focus_topics: Polish Independence, National Celebrations, Military Heritage
activities: education, community events, exhibitions, art competitions
personalization_hooks: The museum organizes a unique cycling event to celebrate Poland's Independence Day, promoting both history and healthy living. | They host an annual art competition for schoolchildren themed around the paths to independence, fostering creativity and historical awareness among the youth. | The museum features interactive exhibitions, including historical reenactments and displays of local military history.
relevance_reasoning: While the museum focuses on Polish military history and independence, it does not specifically emphasize Soviet or Russian military history, limiting its direct relevance for selling authentic Soviet military boots.

summary: The Club of the Warsaw Garrison Command is dedicated to promoting Polish military history and heritage, particularly in relation to national independence. They engage in educational projects, cultural events, and community workshops to foster a deeper understanding of Poland's military past.
focus_topics: Polish Independence, Military Education, Cultural Heritage
personalization_hooks: The organization commemorates significant Polish historical dates, such as the 107th anniversary of Poland's independence. | They host workshops that explore themes of freedom and expression, appealing to a broad audience. | Their library features new military history publications, indicating a commitment to ongoing education and resource availability.
relevance_reasoning: While the organization focuses primarily on Polish military history and independence, it does not specifically emphasize Soviet or Russian military history. The relevance is moderate due to the potential for connections to broader Eastern European military narratives.

It aims to ensure a modern, highly mobile military capable of immediate action and support for the Polish society, while also promoting national defense education among citizens.
focus_topics: Polish military history, National Independence, Defense education
activities: education, public training programs, strategic planning

relevance_reasoning: While the General Staff of the Polish Army is primarily focused on Polish military operations and national defense, it does not directly engage with Soviet or Russian military history. summary: The Memorial of the Second Resistance Movement is a monument in Prague dedicated to the Czech resistance against Nazi occupation from 1938 to 1945. It serves as a tribute to the victims and heroes of the Second Resistance Movement, emphasizing the importance of liberty and national pride.
focus_topics: Czech Resistance, Nazi Occupation, National Liberation
personalization_hooks: The memorial was designed by notable Czech artists, including sculptor VladimÃ­r PreclÃ­k. | The foundation stone was laid on May 4, 2005, marking a significant effort to honor resistance fighters. | The inscription encourages visitors to reflect on the sacrifices made for national freedom, which resonates with themes of valor and resilience.
relevance_reasoning: While the memorial focuses on the Czech resistance during WWII, it has limited direct relevance to Soviet/Russian military history. The context of resistance against Nazi forces may intersect with Soviet military actions, but the primary focus is on Czech national identity rather than Soviet narratives.

summary: The Soviet Military Cemetery - Mausoleum Park serves as a memorial for the Soviet soldiers who fought in the liberation of Warsaw during World War II. It features a large monument and a park-like setting where the remains of over 21,000 soldiers are interred, making it a significant site for remembrance and historical reflection.
focus_topics: Soviet Army, Red Army, Military History, War Memorials
personalization_hooks: The cemetery is the final resting place for over 21,000 Soviet soldiers, showcasing the diverse nationalities that fought under the Soviet flag, including Russians, Ukrainians, and Kazakhs. | It features a unique blend of Soviet-era architecture and park-like elements, making it both a historical site and a recreational area for local residents. | The cemetery includes individual graves for notable officers and collective graves marked by red stars, highlighting the honor and recognition given to those who served.
relevance_reasoning: The cemetery is highly relevant for selling authentic Soviet military boots as it directly connects to the historical context of Soviet soldiers during World War II, appealing to collectors and history enthusiasts interested in authentic military memorabilia.

name: Military History Club
scraped_content: Welcome - The Military History Club Welcome Founded in 2021 by historian and broadcaster Saul David â€“ described by Simon Heffer in the Daily Telegraph as â€˜peerless now among our military historiansâ€™ â€“ the MHC is an exclusive club for lovers of military history with various tiers of membership to suit different levels of involvement. The benefits include: Guest lectures and dinners with celebrated military historians and practitioners at a top London venue Invite to the founderâ€™s book launches The opportunity to write articles for the MHCâ€™s publication Militaria Monthly newsletter with book recommendations Ten classic military history titles in eBook format Monthly podcast interview with a leading military historian Islands, British Virgin Islands, U.S. Wallis and Futuna Western Sahara Yemen Zambia Zimbabwe Ã…land Islands Country How did you hear about the Military History Club? Lecture programme Exclusive to members Location: The Caledonian Club, 9 Halkin Street, Belgravia, London, SW1X 7DR. Tel. 020 7333 8726. The lectures take place in the Stuart Room, followed by dinner in the Selkirk Room. Dress code: lounge suit or tailored jacket and tie, and the equivalent dress for women. The use of mobile phones in the Club is forbidden except in certain designated areas. A limited number of bedrooms are available at the Caledonian Club â€“ on a first come, first served basis â€“ for those MHC members who would like to stay overnight. To book a room, please contact: Reception ( [email protected] ). The Caledonian Club 9 Halkin Street, Belgravia, London, SW1X Forthcoming lectures Wednesday November 12, 2025 Professor Matthias StrÃ¶hn, â€˜The Battle for Berlin, 1945â€™ Followed by dinner Wednesday January 21, 2026 Roger Moorehouse, â€˜Wolfpack: Hitlerâ€™s U-boat War 1939-45â€™ Followed by dinner. Wednesday February 18, 2026 Dr Steven P. Kershaw, â€˜Battle of Marathon, 490 BCâ€™ Followed by dinner. Wednesday March 18, 2026 Nick Hewitt, â€˜Normandy â€™44: the Sailorsâ€™ Storyâ€™ Followed by dinner. Wednesday May 13, 2026 Antonia Senior, â€˜Stalinâ€™s Apostles: The Cambridge Five and the Making of the Soviet Unionâ€™ Followed by dinner. Wednesday June 10, 2026 Professor Saul David, â€˜Operation Bagration: The Red Armyâ€™s Destruction of Army Group Centre, June-July 1944 Followed by dinner. Wednesday September 16, 2026 Dr Spencer Jones, â€˜Operation Michael and the German Spring Offensive, March/April 1918â€™ Followed by dinner Wednesday October 14, 2026 Professor Gary Sheffield, â€˜Attrition and Learning Curves: The British Empire Armies in Italy and North-West Africa, 1943-1945â€™ Followed by dinner. Wednesday November 11, 2026 Hugh Sebag-Montefiore, â€˜Battle of the Arctic: The Maritime Epic of World War Twoâ€™ Followed by dinner. Podcast Members hear first Members have first access to the MHC Podcast, a monthly interview with a leading military historian. The first episode, released to members on 1 January 2022, features founder Saul David in discussion with Professor Richard Overy, one of the worldâ€™s leading authorities on the history of Nazi Germany and the Second World War. His many critically-acclaimed and prize-winning books include Russiaâ€™s War , The Dictators , The Bombing War and, most recently, Blood and Ruins . Other historians who will appear on the MHC Podcast in 2022 include Patrick Bishop, James Holland, Sir Hew Strachan and Richard B. Frank. Great Battles in Ten Minutes Members see first Members have exclusive access to a monthly video of club founder Saul David discussing a â€˜Great Battle in Ten Minutesâ€™. The battles covered in 2022 will include Isandlwana, The Charge of the Light Brigade, Teutoberger Wald, Bannockburn, Blenheim, Quebec, Waterloo, Custerâ€™s Last Stand, the First Day on the Somme and Stalingrad. Saul will analyse each battle by answering five key questions: When? Where? Why? What happened? What was the outcome? Militaria â€“ published annually FREE FOR MEMBERS Gold and Silver Members who would like to try their hand at writing history are invited to contribute a 2,500-word article on a subject of their choice to the MHCâ€™s annual ebook publication Militaria. Copies of the ebook are available to all members free of charge. History Tours EXCLUSIVE TO MEMBERS Monte Cassino/Naples â€“ Wednesday 9-Sunday 13 October 2024 Introduction: The tour will be led by Prof Matthias Strohn, Visiting Professor of Military Studies at the Humanities Research Institute at the University of Buckingham, and, as Senior Associate Fellow, Head of Historical Analysis at the British Armyâ€™s think tank, CHACR. Matthias holds a commission in the German Army and has, among other deployments, served on the defence attachÃ© staffs at the German embassies in Paris, London and Madrid. He has led over 100 battlefield tours and staff rides. 9 Oct: 0735hrs: Meet at London Gatwick (North Terminal). Depart on Easyjet Flight EJU8351 to Naples at 0935hrs. Arrive Naples International Airport at 1320hrs. Tour of Pompeii. Travel to Hotel Rocca in Monte Cassino: https://www.hotelrocca.it/en/home-page.aspx 10 Oct: The prelude to the battle and the first battle of Monte Cassino. We will visit a number of locations, including San Pietro Infine, which was fought over in December 1943, and which was left in its destroyed state after the battle. We will visit the Italian cemetery and memorial at Montelungo and discuss the Italian contribution to the campaign. The German withdrawal from San Pietro opened up the Liri valley and the road to Monte Cassino. We will analyse the first battle of Monte Cassino and we will visit relevant locations, including the Rapido river at St Angelo, where the US troops suffered approx 50% casualties in their attempt to cross the river, and the German military cemetery at Caira, where we will discuss the French attack in the mountains 11 Oct: We will analyse the other 3 battles of Monte Cassino. We will examine the fighting in Cassino itself, and visit the museum dedicated to the battle. We will explore the remaining ruins (that hardly anybody knows about) of the old Monte Cassino, visit Castle Hill and the Monastery, which was bombed by the Allies during the second battle. We will explore the history of Cavendish road, the failed first tank attack through the mountains and the successful Polish attack here during the last battle. At the Polish cemetery we will discuss the Polish contribution to the battle and the enduring political importance of the battle within Poland. 12 Oct: We will travel to Anzio to analyse the Allied landings during Operation Shingle and the heavy fighting and followed. We will visit the American cemetery, the landing beaches, the military museum, and we will explore the fighting further inland, where the Allies were defending against ferocious German attacks. 13 Oct: Return to the UK, departing Naples International Airport on Easyjet Flight EZY8340 at 1035hrs. Arrive London Gatwick (North Terminal) at 1230hrs. Praise for Saul David and Matthias StrÃ¶hnâ€™s previous tours Madrid and The Battlefields of the Spanish Civil War, 20-24 October 2021: Jeremy Archer: â€˜Rack my brain as I might, I cannot think of a single thing that I would have done differently. Our trip was a truly excellent balance between warfare, culture and rest and recuperation. Matthias, I really donâ€™t know how you manage to remain completely unflustered, â€œkeeping your head when all about you are losing theirs â€¦â€ Thank you particularly for making, re-making and then re-re-making the arrangements under such challenging circumstances.â€™ Jim Ferguson: â€˜ Thank you again for another excellent tour. Battlefield tours just would not be the same without your knowledge, perspective and unerring instinct for an excellent restaurant! Already looking forward to 2022.â€™ Jonathan Skan: â€˜ Seeing the places where actual events took place really brought everything to life and I shall always remember standing on the Republican start-line overlooking Brunetta and viewing the countryside where all-arms warfare was put into practice for the first time. I can only imagine how many hours you had to spend organising our four days in Madrid, but I enjoyed it hugely and look forward to next yearâ€™s adventure.â€™ Meet Saul David Saul David is a Sunday Times bestselling military historian, novelist and broadcaster. His history books include The Indian Mutiny (shortlisted for the Westminster Medal for Military Literature), Zulu (a Waterstoneâ€™s Military History Book of the Year), and Operation Thunderbolt: Flight 139 and the Raid on Entebbe Airport (an Amazon History Book of the Year). Alan Furst commented in the New York Times Book Review: â€˜Tense and rivetingâ€¦This is the achievement of a masterly, first-rate historian.â€™ The film rights for Operation Thunderbolt were bought by Hollywoodâ€™s Participant Media and used in the making of the motion picture â€˜Seven Days in Entebbeâ€™ which was released worldwide in the spring of 2018. The film is co-produced by Working Title, directed by JosÃ© Padilha, and stars Rosamund Pike, Daniel BrÃ¼hl and Eddie Marsan. In 2019, he brought out The Force: The legendary Special Ops Unit and WWIIâ€™s Mission Impossible , which was hailed as a â€˜monumental achievementâ€™ (Douglas Brinkley) and â€˜an essential part of anyoneâ€™s libraryâ€™ (Doug Stanton). His follow up book, Crucible of Hell: Okinawa â€“ The Last Great Battle of the Second World War , was published in the spring of 2020 to coincide with the 75th anniversary of the campaign, and was shortlisted for the 2021 British Armyâ€™s Military Book of the Year. It was described by Antony Beevor as â€˜Excellentâ€¦gripping narrativeâ€™ and named as an Amazon.com History Book of the Month and Daily Telegraph and Times/Sunday Times Non-fiction Book of the Year. In a 5-star review in the Daily Telegraph, Simon Heffer described Saul as â€˜peerless now among our military historiansâ€™. SBS: Silent Warriors â€“ The Authorized Wartime History , was published on 2 September 2021 to universal praise. â€˜A terrific book,â€™ wrote James Holland in the Daily Telegraph , â€˜written with all the gusto, thrills and head excitement these SBS operations richly deserve. It really is one of the most enjoyable histories Iâ€™ve read in many a year.â€™ It was an instant Sunday Times Top 10 bestseller, entering the list at No. 9 and climbing to No. 4 . lt includes previously unseen documents from the SBS Association Archives, the first-time that Britainâ€™s top-secret maritime special operations unit has opened its doors to a historian. In 2022, Saul published Devil Dogs: First In, Last Out â€“ King Company from Guadalcanal to the Shores of Japan , about a company of marines fighting its way through the Pacific. It was given a 5-star review in the Sunday Telegraph with Simon Heffer writing: â€˜Superbâ€¦ David has a claim to be our finest living military historian.â€™ It has been named a Times/Sunday Times and Daily Telegraph History Book of the Year. In 2024, Saul published Sky Warriors: British Airborne Forces in the Second World War . James Holland wrote in the Telegraph: â€˜Fascinating and absorbingâ€¦ The Red Devils were mostly young men, as vulnerable as any other soldier. Yet what they achieved, as David makes clear in this hugely entertaining book, was remarkable.â€™ It was a Sunday Times bestseller, reaching No. 8 in the hardback chart. Saulâ€™s latest book, Tunisgrad: Victory in Africa , is published on 11 September 2025. Patrick Bishop described it as â€˜Terrific â€“ full of dramaâ€¦ It has profoundly altered my understanding of the Second World War.â€™ Saul has also written three historical novels, Zulu Hart , Hart of Empire and The Prince and the Whitechapel Murders . Saul has presented and appeared in history programmes for all the major TV and streaming channels. He is a Fellow of the Royal Historical Society and a Professorial Research Fellow at the Humanities Research Institute, University of Buckingham. He was Professor of Military History at the University of Buckingham from 2009-2021. Visit Saul's website â€œSaul David is peerless now among our military historiansâ€ Simon Heffer, The Daily Telegraph Contact If you have a query about any aspect of the Military History Club, or would like help with the application form, please fill in your contact details and leave a message. Donâ€™t forget to click the red â€˜Submitâ€™ button. Saul or one of his assistants will respond as soon as they can. Name Email Message
summary: The Military History Club (MHC) is an exclusive organization founded in 2021, dedicated to enthusiasts of military history. It offers various membership tiers that provide access to guest lectures, publications, and unique events centered around military history.

summary: War Studies University is a premier military academy in Poland that focuses on innovative research and high-quality education in military science, addressing the current and future needs of the Polish Armed Forces. It offers undergraduate, graduate, and postgraduate programs, along with various academic and cultural events.
focus_topics: Military Diplomacy, National Security, Military Management, History and Polemology
personalization_hooks: The university's commitment to preserving military heritage while innovating military thought. | Opportunities for students to engage in prestigious projects and develop valuable competencies for the job market. | The university's extensive research units, including the Institute of History and Polemology, which may focus on Soviet military history.
relevance_reasoning: The university's focus on military studies and history, particularly in relation to national security and military diplomacy, aligns well with the interests of those seeking authentic Soviet military artifacts, such as boots. Their emphasis on research and education in military history makes them a relevant contact for such items.
